snippet: Andy Coulson, the former communications director for Prime Minister David Cameron and a onetime tabloid editor, appeared in court with six other people on Thursday to face hacking charges.
abstract: Andy Coulson, the former communications director for British Prime Min David Cameron and a onetime top editor of tabloid News of the World, appears in court with six other people to face charges in the long-running hacking scandal.

byline.original: By ALAN COWELL and JOHN F. BURNS

lead_paragraph: Andy Coulson, the former communications director for Prime Minister David Cameron and a onetime tabloid editor, appeared in court with six other people on Thursday to face hacking charges.

headline.seo: Andy Coulson and 6 Others Appear in Court on Hacking Charges
headline.main: Ex-Aide to Cameron Appears in Court on Hacking Charges
headline.print_headline: Britain: 7 Appear in Court in Phone Hacking Case

keywords.value: Wiretapping and Other Eavesdropping Devices and Methods
keywords.name: subject
